title: Port Vale approach local rivals Stoke with a cheeky transfer bid - for their SCOREBOARD
text:
The screen, which is still in position at Stoke (Photo: Leicester City C) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Transfers directly between local rivals aren't too common, but League One Port Vale are in a mood to change all that. 
Because while it might be the local derby you list last whenever you try to remember all of English football's inter-city challenges, the Valiants still retain a strong dislike for Premier League neighbours Stoke City . 
But while they don't like them, it seems that they do like their scoreboard. 
So much so, that a cheeky transfer bid has been made for it to see if they can tempt it to cross the divide in the Potteries. Vale Park, minus a massive scoreboard (Photo: Jan Kruger) This is one of Stoke's assets which won't ve making the move across the city (Photo: Alex Livesey) 
With redevelopment work set to take place at the Bet365 Stadium which will mean the removal of the big screen, a Vale supporter asked the club's chief executive/secretary Colin Garlick if they could bring it to Vale Park. 
Garlick then took the suggestion to Stoke, but having been quoted around Â£30,000 to both move and install the screen, it is believed that the club have been put off the move. 
The big screen will now presumably become a free agent, waiting for the next club to register their interest. Like us on Facebook
